main

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Color

  • public class Color
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores a color in the HSV format. H,S,V vales are within [0,1]
    Author:
    Scott Sewell

    • Constructor Detail

      • Color

        public Color()
        Empty Constructor.

      • Color

        public Color(float h,
     float s,
     float v)
        Constructor. Values are clamped to [0,1]
        Parameters:
        h - the hue (what color).
        s - the saturation (how intense that color is).
        v - the value (how bright that color is).

      • Color

        public Color(Color c)
        Clone constructor.
        Parameters:
        c - a non-null color to clone.

    • Method Detail

      • black

        public static Color black()

      • white

        public static Color white()

      • fromRGB

        public Color fromRGB(float r,
            float g,
            float b)
        Converts a color from the RGB color space into an HSV color space.
        Parameters:
        r - the red component [0,1]
        g - the green component [0,1]
        b - the blue component [0,1]
        Returns:
        a new HSV color.

      • lerp

        public static Color lerp(Color c1,
         Color c2,
         float fac)
        Linearly interpolates hsv values of c1 to those of c2 using fac as the blend factor.
        Parameters:
        c1 - the color blended from.
        c2 - the color blended towards.
        fac - blend factor with range [0,1].
        Returns:
        A new color blended between the input colors.

      • getH

        public float getH()
        Returns:
        the hue.

      • getS

        public float getS()
        Returns:
        the saturation.

      • getV

        public float getV()
        Returns:
        the brightness.

      • setH

        public void setH(float h)
        Sets the hue.
        Parameters:
        h - the new hue value.

      • setS

        public void setS(float s)
        Sets the saturation.
        Parameters:
        s - the new saturation value.

      • setV

        public void setV(float v)
        Sets the brightness.
        Parameters:
        v - the new brightness value.
